flawed_nl_solution:
The profit Ronald wants is $3000 / 3 = $<<3000/3=1000>>1000
The profit per phone sold will be $1000 / 200 phones = $<<1000/200=5>>5/phone
The cost of each phone is $3000 / 200 phones = $<<3000/200=51>>51/phone
The selling price including the profit will be $51/phone + $5/phone = $<<51+5=56>>56

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15.0, not 51.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
